title: Italian Language and Cinema in Tuscany
xlist:
Same As: FILM S160, section 01
Same As: HUMS S218, section 01
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description: Offered in Siena, Italy. This five-week course combines beginning Italian with a course in English on Italian cinema focusing on Tuscany. Students will learn Italian through classes and full-immersion in the study-abroad experience (including a homestay), and will explore the representation of Tuscany through the screening and close analysis of films where the Tuscan setting has been elevated to the level of a primary thematic concern. Among the films to be considered are Room with a View, Night of the Shooting Stars, The First Beautiful Thing, Tea with Mussolini, The Sky Is Falling, Life Is Beautiful, Sandra, Mar nero, Good Morning Babylon, Fiorile, and the Florentine episode of PaisÃ . Students who wish to continue with Italian are required to take a placement test in order to place into ITAL 120. Students may petition for one HU credit. Students are responsible for all travel expenses to and from Siena, room and board costs in Italy, and any other expenses beyond tuition. Application deadline: February 15. Enrollment limited. For further information visit the Yale Summer Session Study Abroad website. 2 Credits. Tuition $6,700. Course dates: June 21 - July 26.
